intro: Adeneleuterophora stolonifera, commonly known as the stoloniferous adeneleuterophora, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its creeping growth habit, with stolons that root at the nodes to form new plants. The plant produces small, white to pink flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the summer months. Its leaves are ovate to elliptical in shape, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Adeneleuterophora stolonifera is often found in moist, well-drained soils in temperate regions.
